results.title: Assignment India
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: India as a land of young, exciting ideas on democracy, outgrowing its ancient patterns of caste and custom. How programs in agriculture, industry and education are geared to raise the nation’s standard of living. The reasons for the present views of Indian people, their changing attitudes and their hopes for the future. The US Ambassador to India, Mr Chester Bowles, is seen talking to the Indian Prime Minister, Mr Nehru, and discussing the village development program with a young government worker; the economic race between democratic India and Communist China; the legacy of Ghandi; and concludes with three men active in Indian government and public affairs giving their views on India’s problems and reaffirming their faith in democratic methods for their solution.

results.title: Assertive with adults (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Assertive with adults” focuses on ways of negotiating with parents, teachers and other adults to achieve a satisfactory, or win-win, outcome. Includes personal hints and advice from adults and teenagers such as choosing the right time; listen to what the adult is saying; expressing clearly your wants and needs; negotiating and being prepared to compromise. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Assault on the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Ross Mackenzie, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The story of a CSIRO program in which a black weevil was introduced into New Guinea’s Sepik River in an attempt to control one of the world’s worst water weeds, Salvinia molesta. Narrated by John Stanton.

results.title: Assassination at Sarajevo: pretext for war
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, John Sharnik and CBS News
results.brief_description: This film discusses how the chain of events following the death of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Serbia, allowed Austria to seek revenge and precipitate the outbreak of World War I. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiatry students.

results.title: Assam: where mighty Brahmaputra flows
results.brief_description: Assam is a land of rivers and mountains, famed for its natural beauty. Its industries are sericulture as a cottage industry; metal as a flourishing craft; teas as an important source of foreign exchange; the Digboi Oil Refinery, as the only one of its kind in India; and jute, a very vital product. This is an exotic insight into some of Assam’s cultural aspects by focussing on social behaviour and virtue. Also depicts the fine river, Brahmaputra.
